name: Rossi, Giovanni
description: Chef Giovanni Rossi is a specialist in Italian cuisine with over a decade of experience in the culinary industry.

recipes.name: Pasta Carbonara
recipes.description: Classic Roman pasta dish with bacon, eggs, and cheese
recipes.method: This a classic dish that hails from the town of Amatrice in Italy & is made with a tomato-based sauce, pancetta or guanciale, and pecorino cheese. To start, cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. In a separate pan, cook the pancetta or guanciale until crispy and then add chopped onions and garlic. Once the onions are translucent, add canned tomatoes and let the sauce simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and mix well. Serve with grated pecorino cheese.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
recipes.description: Traditional Neapolitan pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil
recipes.method: This is a vegetarian twist on traditional meatballs that is bursting with flavor. To make the meatballs, roast eggplant in the oven until tender, then mash it with breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, egg, and seasonings. Form the mixture into balls and fry them in a pan until golden brown. Serve the eggplant meatballs with marinara sauce and fresh basil.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
recipes.description: Classic Italian dessert with layers of ladyfingers, espresso, and mascarpone cheese
recipes.method: This is a delicious and simple Italian bread that is perfect for snacking or as an accompaniment to a meal. To make the focaccia, mix flour, yeast, salt, and water in a bowl until a dough forms. Knead the dough for 10-15 minutes until it is smooth and elastic. Let the dough rise for 1-2 hours in a warm place. Once it has risen, shape the dough into a large circle and top with sliced tomatoes, olives, and herbs. Bake the focaccia in the oven at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until golden brown. In a separate pan, cook the pancetta or guanciale until crispy and then add chopped onions and garlic.
